{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3452260,"name":"sam liu","username":"catrix","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/dbc845/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-11-27T13:39:45.848Z","cooked":"

Our team switched to the 2025 beta version of wpilib for our robot code. But when we tried to deploy it to our robot, it is said that the roboRIO must use the 2025 image.

image1873×329 49.2 KB

IIRC, the roboRIO images are downloaded with the game tools, but there’s no 2025 version of NI FRC game tools available.

image1911×1168 112 KB

So, I’m wondering where I can get the 2025 roboRIO image. Any clue is greatly appreciated.

I’ll add the direct download link in case someone else need it.

GitHub

Release NI 2025 Beta Release 2 · wpilibsuite/2025Beta

This release includes roboRIO Image version 1.1 Fixes linkage issues with NetworkTables from LabVIEW

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-12-18T06:35:52.320Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":433,"readers_count":432,"score":146.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":475672,"topic_slug":"where-do-i-get-the-2025-v1-0-roborio-image","display_username":"Kiet Chau","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":"Vivid-Hosting","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/5/0/50d2e846f0add7aa9489092abe0f436644dde98d.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":62,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":59254,"username":"emintz137","name":"Eric Mintz","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/ea5d25/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6398,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CEO @ Vivid-Hosting, Mentor @ Team 1538 / The Holy Cows"},"post_url":"/t/where-do-i-get-the-2025-v1-0-roborio-image/475672/7","custom_user_title":"CEO @ Vivid-Hosting, Mentor @ Team 1538 / The Holy Cows","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3465351,"name":"","username":"robojack","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/49beb7/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-12-30T19:56:58.153Z","cooked":"

I hope this is a good place for my question. I decided to play with WPILib_Windows-2025.1.1-beta-3. I downloaded it and installed it. Was able to compile and example program but couldn’t upload it (I had image 2024_v2.2 and it said I needed 2025_v1.*) After searching, I found the link to download the
ni-frc-2025-game-tools-25.0.0.13. I downloaded it and installed it and when I run the roboRIO Imaging tool (Version 25.0d13) the only image it seems to find is roboRIO_22.5.0.cfg.

I can see the imaging tool in

C:\Program Files (x86)\National Instruments\LabVIEW 2023\project\roboRIO
Tool and the image in

C:\Program Files (x86)\National Instruments\LabVIEW 2023\project\roboRIO
Tool\FRC Images

FRC_roboRIO2_2025_v1.1.img

After a search of the hard drive for roboRIO_22.5.0.cfg I found it in

C:\Program Files (x86)\National Instruments\Shared\Firmware\cRIO\76F2

along with

FRC_roboRIO2_2025_v1.1.img

I must be missing something but is the imaging tool looking for a cfg file, an img file or something else.

Thanks for any help

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-12-30T19:56:58.153Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":187,"reads":348,"readers_count":347,"score":1009.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":475672,"topic_slug":"where-do-i-get-the-2025-v1-0-roborio-image","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/are-we-able-to-use-a-roborio-1-in-2025-frc/480771/10","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Are we able to use a roborio 1 in 2025 FRC","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60576,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/where-do-i-get-the-2025-v1-0-roborio-image/475672/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3465400,"name":"Ryan Blue","username":"Ryan_Blue","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ryan_blue/{size}/174016_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-30T20:18:03.087Z","cooked":"

It sounds like the imaging tool is on the “Update Firmware” option. Select “format target” instead:

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Imaging your roboRIO 1

Configuring the roboRIO: The roboRIO Imaging Tool will be used to image your roboRIO with the latest software. USB Connection: Highlights the USB Type B input at the top of the roboRIO. Connect a U...

If you’re trying to image the roboRIO

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-12-30T20:18:45.041Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":317,"readers_count":316,"score":113.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":475672,"topic_slug":"where-do-i-get-the-2025-v1-0-roborio-image","display_username":"Ryan Blue","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/zero-to-robot/step-3/imaging-your-roborio.html#roborio-imaging-tool","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Imaging your roboRIO 1 — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":215}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":60576,"username":"robojack","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/49beb7/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":29846,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/where-do-i-get-the-2025-v1-0-roborio-image/475672/9","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 1024 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3465687,"name":"","username":"robojack","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/49beb7/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-12-31T15:17:37.628Z","cooked":"

When I select Format Target, nothing shows in the select image window. I can see FRC_roboRIO2_2025_v1.1.img and FRC_roboRIO2_2025_v1.1.zip on the C: Drive but they don’t show in the Select Image screen. In desperation, I copied FRC_roboRIO_2024_v2.2.img and FRC_roboRIO_2024_v2.2.zip from our older machine to the new machine and low and behold the new imaging tool finds the FRC_roboRIO_2024_v2.2.zip file.

I thought maybe after looking at the names maybe the 2 in
FRC_roboRIO2_2025_v1.1.zip
^

made a difference but I copied the file and renamed it without the 2 and it still didn’t show. Then I was trying to compare some of the files using a command line program and in the command window it showed the files as .img.zip and .zip.img. In these directories, File Explorer doesn’t show the .zip or .img on the files so I apparently added the .zip and .image to the files to make that happen. At some point I must have not clicked on the format button per the instructions and when I didn’t see the files, I lost the bubble and flailed around with adding them.

%^%$$ (Profanity is the language computer programmers know best. )

Thanks for the comments about not being in the format mode which led me to do the compare which showed me the error.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-12-31T15:20:26.065Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":447,"reads":278,"readers_count":277,"score":2305.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":475672,"topic_slug":"where-do-i-get-the-2025-v1-0-roborio-image","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/quotes-that-were-said-during-build-season/69972/8428","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":""Quotes" that were said during build season","clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60576,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/where-do-i-get-the-2025-v1-0-roborio-image/475672/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3469195,"name":"","username":"robojack","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/49beb7/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-04T20:21:52.100Z","cooked":"

Wasn’t sure if I should do a new post or not but I’ll try here again first

After getting the files correct, I tried formatting the roboRIO v1 with the 25_v1.1.zip file. The imaging tool formatted the roboRIO and said it was OK but when I tried to deploy code, it still wouldn’t deploy to the roboRIO. I then reformatted back to the 2024_v2.2.zip and ran a 2024 system without problems. I then redeployed 25_v1.1.zip and tried again. Same problem back to 2024_v2.2.zip and works OK. When I tried to deploy 25_v1.1.zip again it is grayed out so I can’t format it now at all.

Questions

Did I mess up something in the process?

Can I not format a 25_v1.1.zip on a roboRIO v1?

I am able to log on to the 2024_v2.2.zip (admin@172.22.11.2) and look around but don’t really want to play around without some suggestions. I’ve seem some suggestions about running the following but not sure what will happen if I do.

nisystemformat -f -t ubifs && nisystemformat -f -t ubifs

I’d just like to see what will import into 2025 correctly

Thanks for any advice

OK I downloaded WPILib_Windows-2025.1.1 and ni-frc-2025-game-tools_25.0_online and installed them. I then used the imaging tool and formatted the roboRIO with FRC_roboRIO_2025_v2.0 using the imaging tool Version 25.0.1. The code deployed OK but when I try to connect with the FRC driver station (Version 25.0) I have red indicators for the communications and robot code.

I can ssh to the roboRIO and log in successfully and I can connect via web successfully. The web page info below seems to indicate things are OK (from my less than expert opinion.) I think I’ve done the right things but still no joy. Any help/ideas appreciated.

Apparently I did not set the team number in the Drive Station. Some how I don’t remember having to do that in the past. The unit is now communicating with the drive station. I seem to have some drive issues but at least I can connect so I can check on some old programs.

I’m constantly amazed about how much more I need to learn about the overall robotics systems. I have a lot of individual knowledge about some things but need to get a better overview. At least we’re getting an earlier start on the software this year.

Thanks for the help.
